Tip #1 Text: Stop thinking about the same negative thoughts over and over again. Practive positive self-reflection.
Tip #2 Text: Learn to forgive. Don't hold grudges understand that everyone is human.
Tip #3 Text: Try doing something relaxing no matter where you are. If you are at work, take a walk during lunch break. If you are home, take a nice warm bath!

Tip #1 Text: Trying listening to some soothing music.
Tip #2 Text: Slow down your breathing. Inhale for 4 seconds, hold for 7 seconds, and exhale for 8. Repeat until more relaxed.
Tip #3 Text: If you are stressed about something specific, for example, a deadline. Make a schedule for when you are going to work and when you are going to take breaks. Making a schedule really helps staying on track, therefore reducing stress.

Tip #1 Text: Social media makes everyone feel bad about themselves because it only highlights the good parts of everyone's lives. Eventhough it make look like someone has a lot of friends and is happy, it can be the exact opposite. Shut off social media and stop comparing yourself to the fake lifestyles of others
Tip #3 Text: If you are feeling very lonely, reaching out to family members and just talking to them will almost always help.

Tip #1 Text: Anxiety is almost always caused by thoughts about the future. Think about what is happening right now and stop worrying about what might happen.
Tip #2 Text: What is almost certainly causing you anxiety is thinking about the worst case scenario. Step back and realize that the worst case scenario isn't very realistic.
Tip #3 Text: Look around you and name three things you see. Then, name three sounds you hear. Finally, move three parts of your body -- your ankle, fingers, or arm.

Tip #1 Text: If you are feeling like you can't accomplish something, take a step out of yourself for a moment and imagine you are a completely different person. Think about what you would tell another person in your situation.
Tip #3 Text: Think about and remember all of the success you have had in your past.

Tip #1 Text: Before going off on a temper tantrum. Think about what you are going to say before you say it. Think about the result of your words and how a litte temper can be very destructive.
Tip #2 Text: As soon as you're thinking clearly, express your frustration in an assertive but nonconfrontational way. State your concerns and needs clearly and directly, without hurting others or trying to control them.
Tip #3 Text: Take a timeout. If you are very angry, walk away and take a break.
